page.title: 13Transport
page.content: 92% of the traffic passing through the area consists of cars or light goods vehicles. Only a small proportion consists of; buses, heavy goods vehicles and motor cycles. The majority of the population travel to work by car. A breakdown of the transport used follows; Car pool 4.7%, Car passenger 6.5%, Car driver 52.3%, Bus 14.1%, Train 1.2%, Motor cycle 2.1%, Pedal cycle 3.5%, Foot 8.2%, Works at home 4.1%, Others 2.3%. Although the railway passes the area, the lack of a halt prohibits use of trains as a means of transport. Children are transported to secondary school by bus and children who live in rural areas come to primary school by mini-bus. A regular bus service runs through the area. Cycling is cheapest, as there is no toll to pay on the Tay Bridge.
